figure.name: Trickster
figure.description: Trickster doesn't belong here!

figure.name: Aφροδίτη
figure.description: Goddess of love and beauty. Her husband, Hephaestus, once caught her in a net with Ares. Hermes offered to trade places with him.

figure.name: Aπόλλων
figure.description: God of music, prophecy, light and mathematics.

figure.name: Άρης
figure.description: God of war and bloodshed. Commonly accompanied by Deimos and Phobos (terror and fear).

figure.name: Άρτεμις
figure.description: Goddess of the hunt and the wild. Protectress of the very young and mothers at childbirth.

figure.name: Αθηνά
figure.description: Goddess of knowhow, handicrafts, agriculture and reason. She won patronage of the city of Athens by giving the olive tree.

figure.name: Δήμητρα
figure.description: Goddess of grain and the harvest, and mother of Persephone (Kore).

figure.name: Διόνυσος
figure.description: God of wine and of tragedy. Like the grape ripped from the vine, Dionysus is destroyed and resurrected.

figure.name: Άδης
figure.description: Lord of the Underworld and god of the riches found within the earth. Brother of Poseidon and Zeus.

figure.name: Ήφαιστος
figure.description: The lame god of fire and the forge (god of fire and smiths). Hephaistos is assisted in his smithy by automated assistants.

figure.name: Ήρα
figure.description: Goddess of marriage. Zeus' sister and wife, and jealous of his various affairs.

figure.name: Ερμής
figure.description: God of trade and thieves. Messenger of the gods and guide of the dead to the Afterworld. Inventor of dice, the lyre (which he gave to Apollo), the flute, and any number of other cunning things.

figure.name: Ἑστία
figure.description: Goddess of the hearth. Daughter of Rhea and Cronus.

figure.name: Ποσειδων
figure.description: God of the sea, horses and earthquakes. Brother of Hades and Zeus and father of Polyphemus. Even more badly tempered than other deities.

figure.name: Ζεύς
figure.description: God of sky, thunder and electricity. Brother of Poseidon and Hades. Husband of Hera.

figure.name: Αιθήρ
figure.description: God of the upper air.

figure.name: Χάος
figure.description: The original void.

figure.name: Χρόνος
figure.description: Eternal time.

figure.name: Έρεβος
figure.description: Darkness and shadow.

figure.name: Γαία
figure.description: Mother Earth.

figure.name: Ημέρα
figure.description: Daylight.

figure.name: Νύξ
figure.description: Night.

figure.name: Τάρταρος
figure.description: The darkest deepest pit.

figure.name: Ουρανός
figure.description: Father Sky, progenitor of Cronos and hence of all the Olympians as well.
